newsitem.title: USA: Miami suburb Sunny Isles votes to incorporate.
newsitem.headline: Miami suburb Sunny Isles votes to incorporate.

text.p: Residents of the Miami suburb of Sunny Isles voted by a 3-1 margin to incorporate as a separate city, elections officials said.
Of the 2,678 voters who participated in Tuesday's election, 72.7 percent voted to make the neighborhood Dade County's 30th city. The affluent beachfront community has about 13,000 residents.
The county commission must now appoint a resident committee to draft a charter, which then must be approved by referendum.
If voters reject the charter, the neighborhood in northeastern part of the county would unincorproated and continue to receive services via by the Metro-Dade government.
Organizers of the incorporation movement said they want to keep county fire and library services but take over police, zoning, code enforcement, recreation and public works.

The election was held on the same day that a group of Miami residents submitted petitions calling for that city to be dissolved and absorbed into the county government. Elections officials verified the petitions Tuesday, and an election on the dissolution proposal must be held within 240 days.
